page.title: 03Transport and Shops
page.content: On the main road the B5068 there is alot of traffic.On the smaller lanes there is not much traffic.There are lots of cyclists in the area some ride there bikes to school.There are several bus stops in Criftins they mainly stop at Ellesmere or Oswestry. If you want to buy groceries in Criftins you would go to Revells,which is owned by Mace.It is mainly run by Mrs. Jones her great grandfather's surname was Revell.The house next door used to be a shop.At Revells they sell sweets,crisps,drinks,fruit and vegtables etc. There is a Post Office in criftins it is owned by Mr.A.Peever.His grand father made some carvings and placed them on his house and the Post Office. The Post Office used to be a Chapel. when the old school burnt down girls came to the chapel for cookery lessons
